displacementae.data.obj3d.generate_data.get_image(vertices, triangles, figsize=(3, 3), dpi=36, lim=1.5, col='white')[source]¶

Plots a 3D view of the object and returns it as a numpy array.

displacementae.data.obj3d.generate_data.vertices_to_images(v, triangles, figsize=(3, 3), dpi=24, lim=1.5, crop=0)[source]¶

Converts a batch of vertices arrays to a batch of figures

Args:
v (ndarray): a 2D array of actions with type int in the form of a

batch of displacement of properties (generating factors). Expects values to be in \(-1,0,1\) with only one active.

triangles (ndarray): Describes the faces of the solid.

The same triangles array is used for all transformed versions of the solid.

figsize (tuple): in inches, describes the figure size for each plot. dpi (int): dots per inch, number of pixels per inch in the figure, lim (int): Extent of the axis displayed is fixed to [-lim,lim]

Returns:

ndarray: a batch of images.

displacementae.data.obj3d.generate_data.vertices_to_colored_images(v, triangles, color_idx, figsize=(3, 3), dpi=24, lim=1.5, crop=0, n_colors=0)[source]¶

Converts a batch of vertices arrays to a batch of figures

Args:
v (ndarray): a 2D array of actions with type int in the form of a

batch of displacement of properties (generating factors). Expects values to be in \(-1,0,1\) with only one active.

triangles (ndarray): Describes the faces of the solid.

The same triangles array is used for all transformed versions of the solid.

figsize (tuple): in inches, describes the figure size for each plot. dpi (int): dots per inch, number of pixels per inch in the figure, lim (int): Extent of the axis displayed is fixed to [-lim,lim]

Returns:

ndarray: a batch of images.

displacementae.data.obj3d.world_model module¶

class displacementae.data.obj3d.world_model.WorldModel(object_dir: str, object_name: str, figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (72, 72))[source]¶

Bases: object

This class maintains a world model of a colored object as it changes orientation and color.

property figsize: Tuple[int, int]¶
property orientation: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]¶
render() → ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]][source]¶

Render the scene at the current position and orientation.

np.ndarray

the rendered image.
